data.title: Always an amazing meal
data.text: We've been to minnies many times since my husband has been stationed here. We always leave full and happy. The atmosphere and people are the best.

data.title: Excellent Soul Food
data.text: You can't go wrong with anything here. My favorite is the fried pork chops on Wednesdays! But all food is delicious and you must try a slice of cake. All of the employees here have that Southern charm sure to put a smile on your face.

data.title: Down Home Cooking - Chicken Lady does it right!
data.text: Ok, want some veggies and good chicken?  Minnie's is right on time.  Great place to meet a client or just take the wife for a "not fast food" lunch!

data.title: Great Soul Food!
data.text: I came here to get a takeout plate for lunch.  The food is excellent!  There's so much variety that it is hard to choose.  It all looks so good and the fried fish was delicious!  I also had the macaroni and cheese and dressing.  All very good!

data.title: Best fried chicken ever!
data.text: If you are looking for no frills and great food you found it. Served cafeteria style there were 5 meats and about ten sides to choose from, plus a handful of desserts. The fried chicken and grouper were the best I've ever had. All of the sides were excellent too and you could tell they were all homemade and served fresh.

data.title: Sometimes described as Soul Food but to me, just good Southern Comfort Food
data.text:
Hurricane Matthew caused us to change our travel plans which ended up with us taking a detour through Columbus. Good thing or we would never have found Mimmie's Uptown Restaurant.

It appears to have been two store fronts pieced together in an old building just south of Downtown. You walk into the right side and immediately walk over to the left side which is the serving line.

It's Cafeteria style but that works. It worked when I was in grade school and stilll works today.

You get in line and you have your choice of 5 meats and up to 12 sides. On  the day we were here, I had the baked Turkey with Cornbread Dressing along with Mashed Potatoes and Gravy with Mac and Cheese as my other side.  My wife had the same except she had creamed corn instead of Mac and Cheese.

It's served in a Styrofoam clam shell like you get for takeout and you pick up a packet of plastic forks, spoons knives and salt and pepper packets along with a napkin and proceed back to the dining room which is the first room you came into. You also fill you beverage containers at this point.

Not fancy but the food was great and I enjoyed every thing I ate. So did my wife.  Plenty of good food at a great price.

Everyone in the serving line was very friendly and you felt you were right at home.

Rather sparce and most of the decorations are the award plaques they have received over the years and the are a large number of those.

Not easy to find if you're not a local but definitely worth the time and effort to find it. I highly recommend

data.title: Mouthwatering
data.text: I liked the variety of side items and single serving desserts.  Bring cash because they don't except plastic ....well worth it.

data.title: Excellent "Home Cooking"
data.text: Excellent Southern Home cooking.  Minnie's Uptown has all that you need.  The chicken is excellent and the servers are all respectful and courteous.  Enjoy your meal!

data.title: Home cooking at its best
data.text: Minnies  is the best  meat and three in Columbus. A cafeteria style place for lunch only with great fried chicken and specials like country captain on wednesdays. Very  popular with  locals.

data.title: Silver Roamers
data.text: Excellent variety of southern style cooking. Very friendly. I want to go again. Everything was hot & delicious.

data.title: After church Sunday delight. I thought I was back at grandma's Sunday dinner.
data.text: Fried chicken is a must! The dressing is the real deal. Don't forget the mac and cheese. Start your diet another day! Enjoy.

data.title: Over the Top Meat & Three!
data.text: If you are in the mood for a good southern meal Minnie's Uptown is a must.  Their award fried chicken is a must.  Along with the fried chicken try the turnip greens, cream corn and pinto beans.  I'm talking some good eats. Minnie's is a true southern experience when you get called "honey," "sweetie," or "sugar."

data.title: Like Eating at Moma's!!
data.text: Great southern homestyle food in plentiful servings with great variety.  Staff is friendly, atmosphere is casual.  Reasonably priced and Delicious!

data.title: Underwhelmed by a local favorite
data.text:
Overview:
– Fried chicken – better than average
– Dressing with gravy – yum!
– Fried okra – some of the best I've ever had
– Cornbread – Good, nothing special
– Mac and cheese – Very mediocre

Food was pretty good, but for the price it was ridiculous. I think it was $10 for a plate consisting of meat with the 3 sides and cornbread at a super divey restaurant when the food was slightly better than average if anything.

Sorely disappointed :(

data.title: Oustanding food and service
data.text:
Now that I have discovered this restaurant, I make sure that I visit at least once a week.  The southern cuisine is ALWAYS fantastic and the employees are as friendly as can be.

The most difficult part of a visit here is deciding upon what you want to eat.  The sweet iced tea is wonderful - true southern style!!

You CANNOT go wrong eating here!!

data.title: You can't go wrong with a visit to Minnie's, a downtown lunch Staple. For over 20 years never been disappointed.
data.text: I always have a difficult time making a choice between the abundant selections. The homemade chicken pot pie and the southern style fried chicken are worth the trouble finding a parking space. For those who are craving fresh vegetables and prepared from scratch home style meals...this is your place.

data.title: A locals favorite!
data.text: Been to Minnie's multiple times and never disappointed with the cuisine.  Always good food, good service and a great local landmark.

data.title: Classic meat and three
data.text: Sweet tea fried chicken and buckets of veggies. Worth the trip to see how we eat down here! Around the corner from where Coca Cola was first formulated and after a big meal at Minnie's one needs a original formula Coke to settle the heavy meal

data.title: Great Southern Homecooking
data.text: This restaurant is a must visit if you love great southern food. The ladies and staff are very pleasant and friendly and you will definitely be satisfied with the selections they have to offer.

data.title: Lunch at Minnie's
data.text: Wife and step granddaughter had fired chicken.  The granddaughter described the fried chicken as awesome.  I had the baked chicken, green bean casserole with pintos.  All were great.  Recommend for lunch.
